title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: The low pressure area over the island continues to persist and cloudy skies can be expected over most parts of the island, today (17), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Bangladesh tense ahead of ousted PM Hasina’s verdict
byline: Several crude bombs exploded in the Bangladesh capital Dhaka on Sunday, police said, heightening tensions ahead of a verdict on Monday in a case against ousted former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina over violence during street protests last year.

title: GMOA to launch trade union action today
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to commence trade union action from 8 a.m. today (17), based on several demands.

title: Another woman arrested for aiding and abetting Kotahena shooting incident
byline: Another woman has been arrested for aiding and abetting the recent shooting and murder of a person in the Kotahena area, by the Colombo District Crime Division.

title: Former GSMB Chairman Anura Walpola arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: The former Chairman of the Geological Survey & Mines Bureau (GSMB), Anura Walpola, has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: At least 32 killed in southeastern Congo after bridge at mine collapsed
byline: A bridge at a mine in southeastern Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) collapsed due to overcrowding, killing at least 32 people, a regional government official said Sunday.

title: Ex-Deputy Speaker Ajith Rajapakse arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Deputy Speaker of Parliament Ajith Rajapakse has arrived at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), a short while ago.

title: Two dead, teenager missing in separate drowning incidents
byline: Multiple drowning incidents were reported across the country yesterday (16), police said.

title: Budget 2026: Second day of Committee Stage Debate commences
byline: The second day of the debate on the Committee Stage or the Third Reading of the 2026 Appropriation Bill, or the 80th Budget Speech, has commenced today (17) under the chairmanship of the Speaker of the House.

title: SJB councillor arrested with cannabis in Badulla
byline: A member of the Kandaketiya Pradeshiya Sabha, representing the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), has been arrested by the Badulla Galauda Police in Pallewatte while in possession of 86 grams of cannabis.

title: GMOA representatives hold discussions with President
byline: A group of representatives of the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA), which began a trade union action this morning (17) based on several demands, has arrived at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Tom Cruise accepts honorary Oscar as he describes filmmaking as ‘who I am’
byline: Tom Cruise accepted an honorary Oscar at the Governors Awards, delivering an emotional speech about his lifelong passion for filmmaking.

title: Ex-minister Keheliya and family served indictments over three cases
byline: Four defendants including former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, his son Ramith Rambukwella and his daughter have been served indictments before the Colombo High Court in two separate cases filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Horrific bus-tanker crash kills at least 35 in Saudi Arabia
byline: At least 35 people died in the early hours of Monday (local time) after a bus carrying Indian Umrah pilgrims in Saudi Arabia crashed into a diesel tanker.

title: NPP defeated in Hakmana cooperative society election
byline: The common opposition has secured victory in the election held to appoint a new Board of Directors and General Assembly representatives for the Hakmana Multi-Purpose Cooperative Society.

title: Ex-Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina convicted of crimes against humanity
byline: A special tribunal in Dhaka has convicted former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina of crimes against humanity for her violent crackdown on student-led protests last year.

title: Ex-Minister Mervyn Silva pleads not guilty to bribery charges
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva today (17) pleaded not guilty before the Colombo High Court of the indictments filed against him by the Bribery Commission, which accused him of illegally acquiring assets while serving as a minister.

title: ‘Police acted for protection of Buddha statue’: Minister responds to tense situation in Trincomalee
byline: The decision to remove the Buddha statue from the premises of the Sri Sambuddha Jayanthi Bodhiraja Viharaya in Trincomalee was taken as a precautionary measure, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala stated in Parliament today.

title: GMOA calls for emergency executive committee meeting to discuss future course of action
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has announced that following the discussion held with the President, an emergency Executive Committee meeting and a Central Committee meeting will be convened, during which future actions will be discussed.

title: Saudi bus crash: Death toll climbs to 45, only one survivor
byline: At least 45 people, most of them from Hyderabad, were killed in a bus accident in Saudi Arabia, the city police chief said on Monday, citing preliminary information.

title: Govt signs agreement to secure US$ 300 million loan from ADB
byline: The government today (17) signed loan agreements to obtain US$ 300 million from the Asian Development Bank (ADB).

title: Ex-Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death over brutal protests crackdown
byline: Sheikh Hasina, Bangladesh’s ousted prime minister, has been sentenced to death after being convicted of crimes against humanity.

title: Sheikh Hasina calls court verdict ‘biased and politically motivated’
byline: Ousted Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina on Monday delivered her first reaction to the death sentence handed to her by the International Crimes Tribunal, calling the ruling “biased, politically motivated” and issued by a “rigged tribunal with no democratic mandate”.

title: Former GSMB Chairman Anura Walpola granted bail
byline: Former Chairman of the Geological Survey & Mines Bureau (GSMB), Anura Walpola, has been granted bail by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court after being arrested earlier today (17) by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Elon Musk reclaims top spot as ‘world’s richest’ as Larry Ellison’s $101B AI gain evaporates
byline: The title of ‘world’s richest person’ has become a revolving door, but for a brief, stunning moment in September, it swung in a surprising direction.

title: Tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka surpass 2 million in 2025
byline: The number of tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka so far in 2025 has surpassed 2 million.

title: Police clarify video footage showing removal of Buddha statue from temple premises in Trincomalee
byline: Sri Lanka Police have issued a statement regarding video footage showing unrest connected to the removal of a Buddha statue from the premises of the Sri Sambuddha Jayanthi Bodhiraja Viharaya in Trincomalee.

title: ADB board approves landmark charter amendment to boost lending capacity
byline: The Asian Development Bank on Monday said that its Board of Governors has approved a historic amendment to the ADB Charter, removing the previous lending cap and enabling a 50 percent increase in annual lending to over 36 billion U.S. dollars annually.

title: Bangladesh’s tribunal sentences ex-home minister Kamal to death for crimes against humanity
byline: Deposed Bangladesh prime minister Sheikh Hasina’s aide, former home minister Asaduzzaman Khan Kamal, was also sentenced to death in absentia on Monday by a tribunal for crimes against humanity during last year’s student uprising.

title: UK Twitter hacker who breached Obama’s account ordered to repay $5.4 million in Bitcoin
byline: A man convicted over a 2020 Twitter hack that compromised accounts of high-profile figures including former U.S. President Barack Obama has been ordered to repay 4.1 million pounds ($5.40 million) worth of Bitcoin, British prosecutors said on Monday.

title: Ministers hold discussion to address issues faced by big onion farmers
byline: A meeting was held today (17) at the Presidential Secretariat with local big onion farmers to develop a structured plan to address the challenges they face.

title: GMOA calls emergency executive committee meeting to discuss future course of action
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has announced that following the discussion held with the President, an emergency Executive Committee meeting and a Central Committee meeting will be convened, during which future actions will be discussed.

title: 2026 Budget: Expenditure heads of Foreign and Justice ministries passed after vote
byline: The expenditure heads of two ministries taken up for debate on the second day of the Committee Stage debate of the 2026 Appropriation Bill, were approved by a majority vote without any amendments.

title: 2,183 complaints related to violence against women lodged since Nov. 2024
byline: A total of 2,183 complaints related to violence against women have been reported since November 2024, the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs has announced.

title: Man who grabbed Ariana Grande at premiere jailed in Singapore
byline: A court in Singapore has sentenced an Australian man to nine days in prison for grabbing Hollywood star Ariana Grande at a movie premiere.

title: Landslide warnings issued to residents of eight districts
byline: Early landslide warnings have been issued to residents of multiple areas in right districts owing to incessant rains experienced in parts of the island.

title: Owner of printing shop used by drug traffickers to brand packages remanded
byline: The owner of a digital printing shop in Mount Lavinia, who was recently arrested by the Central Crime Investigation Bureau (CCIB) along with stickers used for packaging heroin and ICE, as well as the printing machines used to produce them, has been remanded until tomorrow.

title: Amarapura Maha Nikaya issues statement on Trincomalee Buddha statue incident
byline: The Chief Prelate of the Sri Lanka Amarapura Maha Nikaya, Most Venerable Karagoda Uyangoda Maithri Murthy Thero, has sent a letter to the President regarding the incident in which police removed a Buddha statue from a temple premises in Trincomalee.

title: Woman injured in shooting in Meetiyagoda
byline: A woman has sustained injuries in a shooting near a restaurant at the Kiralagahawela junction in Meetiyagoda.

title: NIA arrests another “active co-conspirator” of Delhi suicide bomber
byline: The National Investigation Agency has arrested Jasir Bilal Wani in Srinagar, who was an “active co-conspirator” of suicide bomber Umar un Nabi, in connection with the car blast near the Red Fort last week that claimed 13 lives, officials said on Monday.

title: Woman injured in Meetiyagoda shooting succumbs
byline: A woman who was injured in a shooting incident in Meetiyagoda earlier today (17), has succumbed to her injuries, police stated.
